p: The essential oil of M. piperita contains compounds with properties of biological interest. Some authors believe that the linalool has antifungal, antimicrobial [ 25, 26], antitumor [ 27], antimutagenic [ 28], analgesic, antispasmodic [ 29], anti-inflammatory [ 30], antiparasitic [ 31], antiplatelet, and antioxidant activity [ 32].
